moves.8... Bg4 9. Qe1 O-O 10. Bxc6: there's no reason to trade off the wB yet.
moves.10... bxc6 11. Bg5 h6 12. Bxf6 Qxf6: with the board opening up very fast, white has left himself with the slower Ns and black with the fast Bs.
moves.13. Nd2: white MUST develop. better is 13.Nc3 d4 14.Ne4 Qe6 15.NxB QxN, relieving black of one of his fast moving Bs, then white can begin to move his pieces to the dark squares, negating his opponents wB.
23.Ne4 does white in....he puts his remaining supporting piece in line with his K, creating an easy pin for black's bB.
moves.24. Rfd1 Re4 25. Rac1 Bxd4+ 26. Kh1 Rae8: with a past pawn in the middle of the board, and black prepared to attrite white's pieces away, white yields the board.
